page.title: 07Farming,Grassland,Dairying.
page.content: Agriculture is very important with many people employed directly or indirectly.Farms range from a 3 acre small-holding run on a part-time basis to 100 acres employing a farmer and 2 men.Most farms are tenanted,the Duchy of Lancaster owning some of the west and the Rushton family to the south.The Wyresdale Estate is split into smaller units and let as summer grazing to various farmers on an annual basis. Mainly British Friesian cattle are used for milk production with the milk collected daily by the dairy for marketing. One farmer still bottles his own untreated milk, selling direct to the public.
